Susseški prispeli v Afriko
Že prvi dan je bil za Meghan in Harryja poln uradnih obiskov. Domačini so zaplesali, otroci pa jima podarili risbice.
04 Nov 2019, 18:48 by B. K. P.
V ponedeljek so Harry, Meghan in mali Archie Harrison pristali v Republiki Južni Afriki, kjer bodo preživeli dober teden. Medtem bo Harry obiskal nekaj bližnjih držav, Meghan pa ga bo s sinom počakala, v Južni Afriki bosta imela Susseška tudi največ uradnih obiskov. Že prvi dan zakonca nista imela časa za počitek, saj sta obiskala Nyango, najnevarnejši in obubožan predel v okolici Cape Towna, znan tudi kot južnoafriška prestolnica umorov, kjer so jima prebivalci pripravili topel sprejem, nastopu se je spontano pridružila tudi Meghan in zaplesala z eno od nastopajočih, nekaj svojih gibov je domačinom pokazal tudi Harry in nekatere nasmejal do solz, otroci pa so paru podarili risbice, ki so jih izdelali posebno zanju. Meghan je ob tej priložnosti nagovorila mlade in jim zagotovila, da oba z možem, čeprav od daleč, budno spremljata, kaj se dogaja pri njih in kaj vse prestajajo.Susseška sta se nato sprehodila po Cape Townu, kjer so ju pričakale množice oboževalcev, ena od njih, 81-letna Somaya Ebrahim, ju je bila tako vesela, da jima je skočila v objem, nad čemer sta bila Harry in Meghan seveda presenečena, a sta bila tega tudi izjemno vesela. Edrahimova si ni mogla kaj, da ne bi povprašala, kje je Archie, na kar ji je Meghan odgovorila, da spi. Enainosemdesetletnica je velika oboževalka britanske kraljeve družine. Bila je ena od mnogih, ki so že davnega leta 1947 v Cape Townu pričakali takrat še princeso Elizabeto, ki je bila na obisku v Afriki s starši in sestro.

The Sussexans arrived in Africa
The first day was full of official visits for Meghan and Harry. The locals danced and the children gave them drawings.
04 Nov 2019, 18:48 by B. K. P.
On Monday, Harry, Meghan and little Archie Harrison landed in the Republic of South Africa, where they will spend a good week. In the meantime, Harry will visit some nearby countries and Meghan will wait for him and his son, and South Africa will have the most official visits in South Africa. Spouses had no time to rest for the first day, as they visited Nyango, the most dangerous and impoverished area in Cape Town, also known as the South African capital of murder, where residents welcomed a warm reception, and Meghan spontaneously joined them and danced with one Harry also showed some of his movements to the locals, and some of them laughed to tears, and the children presented the couple with drawings that were made specifically for them. On this occasion, Meghan addressed the young people and assured them that they, both from afar, were closely watching what was happening to them and what they were going through. of them, 81-year-old Somaya Ebrahim, was so pleased that she jumped into their arms, and of course Harry and Meghan were surprised, but they were also extremely pleased. Edrahim could not help but ask where Archie was, to which Meghan replied that she was sleeping. The 18-year-old is a huge fan of the British royal family. She was one of the many who awaited Princess Elizabeth in Cape Town back in 1947, who was visiting Africa with her parents and sister.
